root.name: line()
root.description: Draws a line (a direct path between two points) to the screen. The version of line() with four parameters draws the line in 2D. To color a line, use the stroke() function. A line cannot be filled, therefore the fill() method will not affect the color of a line. 2D lines are drawn with a width of one pixel by default, but this can be changed with the strokeWeight() function. The version with six parameters allows the line to be placed anywhere within XYZ space. Drawing this shape in 3D using the z parameter requires the P3D or OPENGL parameter in combination with size as shown in the above example.
root.syntax: line(x1, y1, x2, y2) line(x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2)

parameter.label: x1
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: y1
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: z1
parameter.description: int or float: z-coordinate of the first point

parameter.label: x2
parameter.description: int or float: x-coordinate of the second point

parameter.label: y2
parameter.description: int or float: y-coordinate of the second point

parameter.label: z2
parameter.description: int or float: z-coordinate of the second point
